content.description:
Still in need of some cleaning, but traffic will help a lot.

Start down and right of the obvious pocket in the slab. Once at the pocket, there are another several feet of slightly dimpled sandstone slab that must be surmounted before victory is yours.

Sunset hits the slab this time of year.
content.location: On the boulder directly opposite Tiptoe. Start down and right from the obvious pocket.

content.description:
Start on a left gaston crimp and a right sidepull on the right side of the slightly scooped face. Make a move up and left to a sharp pocket. Top out on easy but potentially loose ground. Some traffic will hopefully clean this boulder up rather nicely.

Likely the least ballsy of the easy problems at Potter's Point.
content.location:
Begin at the base of Rapunzel's Tower. Walk about 20-30 feet toward the ocean. You will be between two very large boulders. The left one has some hard slab projects and the right one has a slightly scooped face. Start on the right side of the scoop.

Middle Area, Schoolgirl Boulder

content.description:
Start on the ledge at the bottom left of the boulder. Using some booty tension to campus your way out right to the perfect jugs.

Do some more trickery to press it out on the jugs and reach back left for the dish.

Finish on easier terrain straight up.

An interesting, fun and unique sequence.
content.location:
This face can be seen while standing at Ballet Lessons/Serious as a Schoolgirl. Look toward the Jacked and Tan boulder, it's directly in front of it from there.

Or, from the Jacked and Tan boulder, follow a faint path directly towards Ballet Lessons.

content.description: Start on a crimp rail with an optional right hand pocket. Make some balancy moves on really gritty rock to gain jugs. Proceed through the tree to the top.
content.location: Middle Area, Schoolgirl Boulder. If at Stomp!, go around the boulder to the right. You will pass a smaller boulder and go down a slight incline. It is a few feet to the left of the tree.

content.description:
Start with the left hand on a beverage coaster size crimp and the right on a right hand sidepull crimp (left start hold for Tiptoe). Make a tough move to the sharp pocket. Finish as for Tiptoe.

Essentially a variation start for Tiptoe, but significantly more challenging and fun.
content.location:
Middle Area, Schoolgirl Boulder.

Directly to the left of Tiptoe

content.description:
Climb out of the bush, starting with a cool water runoff sloper rail for the right and a good nubbin for the left. Make some balancy moves to mantle into the cave. Now exit right out the cave onto the slab using a jug pocket and some large dishes. The last few moves are easy, but falling is not a good choice and all the top holds are slopers.

In short, a fun physical crux low with a spicy mental crux high.
content.location:
Middle Area, Schoolgirl Boulder.

About ten feet right of Trampsylvania, and on the opposite side of the boulder as Stomp!

content.description:
Sit down start as low as you can at the bottom left of the blunt prow, with left hand on a block near head height, and right hand on a low sidepull. Follow the bulge up and right using all kinds of crimps, sidepulls, pinches and heel hooks.

Packs a good amount of climbing into a small boulder.
content.location:
On the same boulder as Undertaker, on the other side.

From Arboretum, look back towards the main bouldering area/Ballet Lessons. Follow a faint trail through the brush. Overtaker is on the blunt prow/bulge about 30 seconds from Arboretum.

content.description: Sit start underneath the boulder with the right hand in a weird edge/ upward one finger, you'll know it when you feel it, and the left on an okay pinch, massive move up to the two finger pocket, right hand up to the good holds on the arete and then figure it out from there.
content.location:
The route directly to the route of Tip-Toe, starting way underneath.

Middle Area, School Girl Boulder

content.description:
Start as for Hightower; at the base of the cream-colored scoop on some slopey holds. Make several moves up and right culminating in a large move right to the large crescent edge in Tiptoe and Stomp. Finish as for those climbs.

Not quite as committing as Hightower and a touch more difficult.
content.location: Schoolgirl Boulder. Start as for Hightower and finish on Tiptoe

content.description:
Start on two pinch jugs near waist height. Bust moves straight up.

The area is a little cramped, but the sequence is fun.
content.location: About 10 feet passed Walking on Sunshine boulder, this leaning boulder can be seen off to the left. It's leaning over another boulder, with a smaller boulder in front creating a mini alcove.

content.description:
Start at the base of the cream-colored scoop with a left hand in a slopey pocket and a right hand sloper. Make a few burly moves up and right, following a series of slopers and edges, then mantle into the scoop. Continue up and right on committing, but not too difficult, ground.

Gorgeous. Will probably get your heart fluttering a bit.
content.location: On the Schoolgirl Boulder, directly to the left of Tiptoe and Stomp.

content.description: A gorgeous semi-highball with a spicy landing. Recommendations, don't fall. Great holds, not as scary as it looks.
content.location: If standing directly in front of the Jacked and Tan traverse, walk down the hill to the right past Arboretum and Old Gregg for about 50-75 yards. This problem climbs a somewhat tall stand alone boulder.

content.description: Start crouched with a good left hand edge and mediocre right hand pinch. Head up out of the alcove with the use of some tricky and powerful beta, then negotiate an engaging and fun topout. A fantastic line, but, as with all new problems in SB, has a few holds of suspect nature. It's a great problem now, and hopefully will be a great problem in the future.
content.location: If standing at the base of Serious as a Schoolgirl, face directly inland. Ballet Lessons goes out of an alcove straight up the middle of the face in the center of your view.

content.description: Start on a few good edges. Make some slabby moves up and left. Everything is a bit grainy or suspect. Once it cleans up it will be really nice though.
content.location: Middle Area, Slab Boulder. About ten feet left of Walking on Sunshine
